thread.title: Snowfall warnings and weather statements issued for the region | CTV Barrie News
thread.title_full: Snowfall warnings and weather statements issued for the region | CTV Barrie News

author: CTV Barrie
title: Snowfall warnings and weather statements issued for the region | CTV Barrie News
text:
Environment Canada says the region could receive up to 15 cm of snow on Sunday. Environment Canada warns the snow will start late Sunday morning and end near midnight.
A snowfall warning has been issued for:
Vaughan – Richmond Hill – Markham A special weather statement has been issued for:
Barrie - Collingwood - Hillsdale Midland - Coldwater - Orr Lake Orillia - Lagoon City - Washago Innisfil - New Tecumseth - Angus Orangeville - Grand Valley - Southern Dufferin County Shelburne - Mansfield - Northern Dufferin County Newmarket - Georgina - Northern York Region Uxbridge - Beaverton - Northern Durham Region Bracebridge – Gravenhurst - Huntsville Port Carling - Port Severn Town of Parry Sound - Rosseau - Killbear Park Hanover - Dundalk - Southern Grey County Owen Sound - Blue Mountains - Northern Grey County Bayfield Inlet - Dunchurch The fresh snow will come courtesy of a Colorado low. Hazardous winter travelling conditions are expected, with roads becoming slippery and snow covered. Drivers should allow extra time to reach their destinations.
